conclusion: Introduction to the problem setup with rods OA and OB, rings E and F, and mass m at point D.
OA is vertical, OB is at a 45-degree angle to OA, and both rods are in the same plane.
Rings E and F can move freely on OA and OB respectively, connected by a non-extendable light rope.
The problem requires finding forces F1 and F2 when the object is at rest.
Since the system is in equilibrium, forces and torques must balance out.
The mass m exerts a downward force of mg on the rope.
For ring E on rod OA, the forces must balance for equilibrium.
For ring F on rod OB, the forces must balance for equilibrium.
Denote the tension in the rope as T.
For ring E, F1 is horizontal, perpendicular to the vertical rod OA.
For ring F on OB, F2 is perpendicular to the rod OB.
The tension T is continuous along the rope, but its direction changes at point D.
At point D, the mass m is suspended with tensions from rings E and F.
Tension from E is directed upwards along OA, and tension from F is along OB.
Forces at D: T_E upwards, T_F along OB, mg downward; vector sum must be zero.
Resolve forces into components with OA along y-axis and OB at 45 degrees.
T_E is along the positive y-axis; T_F components are horizontal T_F cos(45°) and vertical T_F sin(45°).
